Package view

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
view.GUI
public class GUI extends javafx.application.Application
This class contains everything necessary for the GUI of the Apicius application. The application starts on the home screen, and the user can use the buttons on the sidebar to switch between the different menus.
This application contains four different menus: Home, Search, Favorites, and Pantry.
  • The Home menu simply acts as a landing for the user to decide what other menu they would like to navigate to.
  • The Search menu allows the user to search for recipes using keywords and refine that search through filters and sorting.
  • The Favorites menu allows the user to scroll through the recipes they have added to their favorites in the past. They may edit this list by removing or rearranging entries or they can tap the recipes to open them.
  • The Pantry menu allows the user to add ingredients from a predetermined list to their "virtual pantry", remove items from this list, or conduct a recipe search that yields a list of recipes that they can make based on what's in their pantry.


This is a JavaFX application.
Author:
Katherine Wilson
See Also:

  • Controller

    private void

    Slides a Node down from off-screen into view.
    private void
    slideLeft(javafx.scene.Node toSlide)
    Slides a Node left from off-screen into view.
    At the end of the sliding animation, the Node will bounce twice.
    private void
    slideRight(javafx.scene.Node toSlide)
    Slides a Node off-screen to the right.
    private void
    slideUp(javafx.scene.Node toSlide)
    Slides a Node up from off-screen into view.
    If this function is called from the Search menu, then the given Node will "bounce" at the end of the slide and the searchToolbar and searchInfo will also be given animations to play.
    If this function is called from the Favorites menu, then the menuTitle will slide down once this animation completes.

  • Field Details

    • searchButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button searchButton
      Button on sidebar that switches the scene to the Search menu.

    • favoritesButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button favoritesButton
      Button on sidebar that switches the scene to the Favorites menu.

    • pantryButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button pantryButton
      Button on sidebar that switches the scene to the Pantry menu.

    • recipeSubset

      private static ArrayList<Recipe> recipeSubset
      Default list of recipes to show when the user navigates to the search menu. This gives them something to scroll through before they perform a search.

    • obsResults

      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<Recipe> obsResults
      Observable list of recipes linked to the searchResults TableView. This list's contents provide the rows for the table.

    • filtersActive

      private boolean filtersActive
      Flag for search filters. If any filters are active, this flag will be true, if not, then this flag will be false.

    • currentRecipe

      private Recipe currentRecipe
      Recipe that is currently open or otherwise selected across the various menus.

    • searchResults

      private javafx.scene.control.TableView<Recipe> searchResults
      Table of search results either from the Pantry or Search features. It contains 5 columns: recipeNameCol, lengthCol, stepsCol, numIngredientsCol, and ingredientsCol.

    • recipeNameCol

      private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Recipe,String> recipeNameCol
      Column in the searchResults table that stores the names of each recipe.

    • lengthCol

      private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Recipe,Integer> lengthCol
      Column in the searchResults table that stores the time it takes to make each recipe (in minutes).

    • stepsCol

      private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Recipe,Integer> stepsCol
      Column in the searchResults table that stores the number of steps it takes to make each recipe.

    • numIngredientsCol

      private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Recipe,Integer> numIngredientsCol
      Column in the searchResults table that stores the number of ingredients it takes to make each recipe.

    • ingredientsCol

      private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Recipe,String> ingredientsCol
      Column in the searchResults table that stores the ingredients needed to make each recipe.

    • searchToolbar

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox searchToolbar
      Brown bar that contains the search bar, search button, and filter button above the recipe table. A drop-down animation on this node plays when the user first navigates to the Search menu.

    • searchInfo

      private javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane searchInfo
      BorderPane that contains two Labels: recipesFound and filtersApplied. This is located between the brown search toolbar and the recipe table.

    • searchBar

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField searchBar
      Area where user can type a keyword to search the database for recipes. If this node is currently focused and ENTER is pressed, a search will be conducted and the results will appear in the table (if any).

    • searchBarButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button searchBarButton
      Magnifying glass button to the right of the search bar in the search menu. Clicking this button performs a search based on what has been typed in the searchBar.

    • filterButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button filterButton
      Button with an image of three bars on it. Clicking this button toggles the filterMenu StackPane.

    • filterMenu

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane filterMenu
      Menu that displays three sliders and their respective check boxes that can be used by the user to refine their search (lengthSlider, stepsSlider, ingredientsSlider). Also contains the confirmFilterButton and clearFilterButton.

    • lengthCheckBox

      private javafx.scene.control.CheckBox lengthCheckBox
      Checkbox in the hideFilterMenu() that enables the lengthSlider.

    • stepsCheckBox

      private javafx.scene.control.CheckBox stepsCheckBox
      Checkbox in the hideFilterMenu() that enables the stepsSlider.

    • ingredientsCheckBox

      private javafx.scene.control.CheckBox ingredientsCheckBox
      Checkbox in the hideFilterMenu() that enables the ingredientsSlider.

    • confirmFilterButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button confirmFilterButton
      Applies filters to the current recipe search based on the three sliders (lengthSlider, stepsSlider, ingredientsSlider).

    • clearFilterButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button clearFilterButton
      Removes the filters currently applied to the recipe search. Clicking this button will redo the search process.

    • lengthSlider

      private org.controlsfx.control.RangeSlider lengthSlider
      Slider that allows the user to filter recipes based on a minimum and maximum number of minutes. This can only be used if lengthCheckBox has been selected.

    • stepsSlider

      private org.controlsfx.control.RangeSlider stepsSlider
      Slider that allows the user to filter recipes based on a minimum and maximum number of steps. This can only be used if stepsCheckBox has been selected.

    • ingredientsSlider

      private org.controlsfx.control.RangeSlider ingredientsSlider
      Slider that allows the user to filter recipes based on a minimum and maximum number of ingredients. This can only be used if ingredientsCheckBox has been selected.

    • recipesFound

      private javafx.scene.control.Label recipesFound
      Message that appears in the searchInfo node that tells the user how many recipes are in the recipe table.

    • filtersApplied

      private javafx.scene.control.Label filtersApplied
      Message that appears in the searchInfo node that tells the user how many filters are applied to the current search.

    • noRecipesFound

      private javafx.scene.control.Label noRecipesFound
      Message that is displayed when no recipes were found matching the user's search term or after they filtered their search.

    • recipeMenu

      private javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane recipeMenu
      "Window" that pops up when a user clicks on a recipe. This displays all information in the database about the recipe. The user can scroll around this window or use the buttons at the top to add the recipe to their favorites or close it.

    • ingredientsBox

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox ingredientsBox
      List of ingredients shown on the left side of the recipeMenu.

    • directionsBox

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox directionsBox
      List of directions shown on the right side of the recipeMenu.

    • recipeMenuButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button recipeMenuButton
      Red "X" button in the top right corner of the recipe window. This is used to close the recipe window (recipeMenu).

    • recipeTitle

      private javafx.scene.control.Label recipeTitle
      Title of the recipe shown in a bold font at the top of the recipe window.

    • recipeLength

      private javafx.scene.control.Label recipeLength
      Displays the number of minutes it takes to make the recipe under the title in the recipe window.

    • recipeSteps

      private javafx.scene.control.Label recipeSteps
      Displays the number of steps it takes to make the recipe under the title in the recipe window.

    • recipeIngredientCount

      private javafx.scene.control.Label recipeIngredientCount
      Displays the number of ingredients it takes to make the recipe under the title in the recipe window.

    • recipeFavoriteButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button recipeFavoriteButton
      Star button in the top left corner of the recipe window. Clicking this button adds or removes the recipe from the user's favorites list.

    • obsFavorites

      javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> obsFavorites
      Observable list of recipes linked to the rows of the favoritesList ListView.

    • nameToRecipe

      private HashMap<String,Recipe> nameToRecipe
      Maps the name of a recipe to its corresponding Recipe object. This is used to "translate" the data in a ListCell (just a recipe name) into a full Recipe object.

    • favoritesList

      private javafx.scene.control.ListView<String> favoritesList
      Displays the name of each recipe in the user's favorites list using rows.

    • openFavoriteButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button openFavoriteButton
      Blue "Open" button that appears when a user clicks on a recipe in their favorites list. Clicking this button will open a recipeMenu window that shows more information about the recipe.

    • deleteFavoriteButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button deleteFavoriteButton
      Red "Delete" button that appears when a user clicks on a recipe in their favorites list. Clicking this button will delete the recipe from their favorites and update the list visually.

    • upArrow

      private javafx.scene.control.Button upArrow
      Green up-arrow button that appears when a user clicks on a recipe in their favorites list. Clicking this button will move the highlighted recipe up by one row in the list.

    • downArrow

      private javafx.scene.control.Button downArrow
      Green down-arrow button that appears when a user clicks on a recipe in their favorites list. Clicking this button will move the highlighted recipe down by one row in the list.

    • favoritesButtons

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox favoritesButtons
      Section between the title and the favorites list where the openFavoriteButton, deleteFavoriteButton, upArrow, and downArrow buttons appear.

    • obsIngredients

      javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> obsIngredients
      Observable list of ingredients linked to the rows of the ingredientsList ListView.

    • currentIngredient

      private String currentIngredient
      String representing the ingredient currently selected by the user. This is used to determine which String to delete from the pantry list.

    • allIngredients

      private List<String> allIngredients
      A list of all ingredients in the database.

    • pantryChanged

      private boolean pantryChanged
      true if changes were made to the pantry while in the pantrySearchMenu or
      false if no changes were made. This is used to determine if the search should be redone to reflect pantry changes.

    • pantryIngredientsMenu

      private javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane pantryIngredientsMenu
      Menu first shown to the user when they click on the pantryButton. It displays the user's "virtual pantry" (the list of ingredients they have created).

    • pantrySearchMenu

      private javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane pantrySearchMenu
      Menu that is shown when the user makes a "pantry search". This menu includes a back arrow button to return to the pantryIngredientsMenu, a table of search results, and a button for filtering the results.

    • ingredientsList

      private javafx.scene.control.ListView<String> ingredientsList
      List of ingredients the user has added to their "virtual pantry". Contains one ingredient per row.

    • ingredientSearchBar

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField ingredientSearchBar
      TextField that user can use to add ingredients to their "virtual pantry". This field uses auto-complete functionality that is bound to the allIngredients list.

    • deleteIngredientButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button deleteIngredientButton
      Red "delete" button used to remove an ingredient from the user's virtual pantry. This will visually update the ingredientsList.

    • pantrySearchButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button pantrySearchButton
      "See what you can make!" button at the button of the pantryIngredientsMenu. Clicking this button starts a pantry search and switches to the pantrySearchMenu.

    • backButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button backButton
      Button in the top left corner of the pantrySearchMenu that brings the user back to the pantryIngredientsMenu.

    • menuTitle

      private javafx.scene.control.Label menuTitle
      Title shown at the top of a menu. This is used by the Favorites and Pantry menus.

    • menu

      static javafx.scene.Parent menu
      Menu displayed to the user (Home, Search, Favorites, or Pantry). This is provided by an FXML file.

    • stage

      static javafx.stage.Stage stage
      Used to display scene.

    • scene

      static javafx.scene.Scene scene
      Scene to be displayed by the stage.

    • controller

      static Controller controller
      Controller through which the GUI interacts with the Model. This field is static because it is shared between all instances of this class.

    • model

      static Model model
      Model that stores user data and manages any connections between this application and the recipe database. This field is static because it is shared between all instances of this class.

    • RECIPE_SUBSET_FILE

      static final String RECIPE_SUBSET_FILE
      Name of a file that contains a list of 50 recipes. This database subset is used to show some recipes to the user by default when they navigate to the search menu, so it doesn't look so empty.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • currentMenu

      static char currentMenu
      Represents the menu currently being shown to the user. This takes on one of four values:
      • 'h' = Home menu
      • 's' = Search menu
      • 'f' = Favorites menu
      • 'p' = Pantry menu

  • Constructor Details

    • GUI

      public GUI()

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Starts the GUI for the Apicius application. Initializes everything needed for the stage and shows it to the user. This includes the user data, which is loaded in by the model as well as a list of all ingredients in the database located in a text file. This function is called only once on startup and will initialize the model and controller for the application.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - Stage to be displayed to the user
      Throws:
      IOException - if the following files are not present in the project's directory: Home.fxml, recipe_subset.dat

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Called when an FXML is loaded to initialize necessary Nodes for the menu that was loaded in.
      This function will create a new GUI instance, which is why some fields (Ex. model and controller) must be static.

    • searchButtonHandler

      public void searchButtonHandler()
      Switches to the Search menu. This is loaded in from the "Search.fxml" file. This file must be present in order for this function to work properly. Also updates the currentMenu global variable.

    • favoritesButtonHandler

      public void favoritesButtonHandler()
      Switches to the Favorites menu. This is loaded in from the "Favorites.fxml" file. This file must be present in order for this function to work properly. Also updates the currentMenu global variable.

    • pantryButtonHandler

      public void pantryButtonHandler()
      Switches to the Pantry menu. This is loaded in from the "Pantry.fxml" file. This file must be present in order for this function to work properly. Also updates the currentMenu global variable.

    • searchForRecipes

      public void searchForRecipes()
      Searches for recipes in the database based on what has been typed into the searchBar TextField. This is called when ENTER is typed into the searchBar or the searchBarButton is clicked. After retrieving a list of Recipe results based on the search query, this function will also manage any visual updates necessary when making the search.

    • hideFilterMenu

      public void hideFilterMenu()
      Makes the filterMenu invisible. Called when the searchBar is clicked.

    • clearFilter

      public void clearFilter()
      Clears the filter(s) applied by the user to their recipe search. Makes another standard or pantry search after the filters have been cleared to show the previous, unfiltered results.

    • resetFilter

      public void resetFilter()
      Deselects all filter CheckBoxes and resets the filter sliders and their selected values to their default states.

    • searchBarHandler

      public void searchBarHandler(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent key)
      Makes a search when the user types ENTER into the searchBar.
      Parameters:
      key - KeyEvent triggered by the user. If its KeyCode is ENTER, then a search will be conducted.
      See Also:
      • searchForRecipes()

    • getSliderMaximums

      private void getSliderMaximums(int[] ranges)
      Calculates what the highest value possible for the RangeSliders should be. This is based on the maximum values found for each filterable column in the current search results.
      Parameters:
      ranges - Stores the end-points for each of the three sliders. This should be a 3-item array. The end-points are stored in the following order: length, steps, ingredients. This array should be initialized with all 0 values.

    • formatSlider

      private void formatSlider(org.controlsfx.control.RangeSlider slider, int max)
      Formats the given RangeSlider to fit with the filterMenu.
      Parameters:
      slider - RangeSlider in the filterMenu.
      max - Maximum value of slider.

    • updateSliderLabels

      private void updateSliderLabels()
      Updates the "label" for the three RangeSliders in the filterMenu to match the current high and low values of each slider. The label is technically a part of the slider's corresponding CheckBox.

    • filterButtonHandler

      public void filterButtonHandler()
      Toggles the filterMenu. This cannot be done if there are no search results to be filtered.

    • toggleLengthSlider

      public void toggleLengthSlider()
      Toggles the lengthSlider. This is called when the user selects or deselects the lengthCheckBox.

    • toggleStepsSlider

      public void toggleStepsSlider()
      Toggles the stepsSliders. This is called when the user selects or deselects the stepsCheckBox.

    • toggleIngredientsSlider

      public void toggleIngredientsSlider()
      Toggles the ingredientsSlider. This is called when the user selects or deselects the ingredientsCheckBox.

    • getRanges

      private int getRanges(int[][] ranges)
      Gets the ranges from the length, steps, and ingredients sliders of the filterMenu. These are used to filter recipe search results.
      Parameters:
      ranges - out-parameter; stores the minimum and maximum of each of the three sliders. This should be a [3][2] array. The ranges are stored in the following order: length, steps, ingredients.
      Returns:
      an int representing the number of filters that have been activated by the user based on their respective CheckBoxes.

    • filterRecipe

      private boolean filterRecipe(Recipe recipe, int[][] ranges)
      Determines if the given recipe should remain in the search results based on the filters added by the user. For each filter, the function will check if it's enabled and then decide if the recipe should be filtered based on the criteria set by it.
      Parameters:
      recipe - Recipe to be filtered or kept.
      ranges - Stores the minimum and maximum values of each of the three sliders. This should be a [3][2] array. The ranges should be stored in the following order: length, steps, ingredients.
      Returns:
      true if the Recipe passes the filters or
      false if the Recipe has been filtered

    • filterResults

      public void filterResults()
      Applies the user's search filters to the current searchResults. This function will also handle any necessary visual updates to the following nodes: filterMenu, filtersApplied, recipesFound, noRecipesFound, and searchResults. This function updates obsResults and filtersActive.
      This is used by both the Search and Pantry menus.

    • selectRecipe

      public void selectRecipe()
      Determines what Recipe to set the currentRecipe pointer to. This is generally called by TableView and ListView nodes when one of their items has been clicked. This function will set the currentRecipe equal to that item, so that other functions know what recipe is currently selected by the user.
      If the currentMenu is the Favorites menu, then this will make the favoritesButtons bar visible.

    • favoriteCellClicked

      public void favoriteCellClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event in which the user clicks on a recipe in their favoritesList.
      • If the user clicks only once, then the recipe will be selected and the user can choose to open, delete, or change its position in the favorites list.
      • If the user clicks twice, then the recipe will be selected and opened.
      • If the user clicks once on an already selected recipe, then the recipe will be deselected.
      Parameters:
      event - MouseEvent triggered by the user on the favoritesList.
      See Also:
      • selectRecipe()

    • openRecipeMenu

      public void openRecipeMenu()
      Makes the recipeMenu visible for the currentRecipe. Populates the recipeMenu's nodes with data such as the recipe's name, number of steps/ingredients/minutes to make, list of ingredients, and list of steps.

    • closeRecipeMenu

      public void closeRecipeMenu()
      Closes the recipeMenu. If changes were made in to the pantry in the pantrySearchMenu, then its search results will be updated to match the new pantry.

    • hoverOverStar

      public void hoverOverStar()
      Changes the color of the star-shaped recipeFavoriteButton if the user hovers over it on an unfavorited-recipe.
      See Also:
      • hoverOverStar()

    • exitStar

      public void exitStar()
      Returns the color of the star-shaped recipeFavoriteButton back to the original when the user's cursor leaves it.
      See Also:
      • exitStar()

    • toggleFavorite

      public void toggleFavorite()
      Adds or removes a recipe from the user's favoritesList. Updates the obsFavorites list and the look of the recipeFavoriteButton depending on if the recipe was added or removed.

    • moveFavoriteUp

      public void moveFavoriteUp()
      Moves a Recipe up in the user's favoritesList.

    • moveFavoriteDown

      public void moveFavoriteDown()
      Moves a Recipe down in the user's favoritesList.

    • ingSearchBarHandler

      public void ingSearchBarHandler(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent key)
      Adds the ingredient typed by the user to the their ingredientsList when they press ENTER.
      Parameters:
      key - KeyEvent triggered by the user. Ignores all inputs except for KeyCode ENTER.

    • addIngredient

      public void addIngredient()
      Adds the ingredient typed by the user into the ingredientSearchBar. If the ingredient is not in the allIngredients list (or it has already been added by the user), then the addition will be rejected and the ingredientSearchBar will shake and display an error message.

    • ingredientCellClicked

      public void ingredientCellClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Shows deleteIngredientButton when the user clicks on an ingredient in their pantry (ingredientsList). Deselects the ingredient if it was previously selected when it was clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - MouseEvent triggered by the user on the ingredientsList.

    • deleteIngredient

      public void deleteIngredient()
      Removes the currently selected ingredient (currentIngredient) from the user's "virtual pantry" (ingredientsList).

    • pantrySearchButtonHandler

      public void pantrySearchButtonHandler()
      Makes a pantry search when the pantrySearchButton is clicked.
      See Also:
      • makePantrySearch(boolean)

    • makePantrySearch

      private void makePantrySearch(boolean slideIn)
      Makes a pantry search based on all of the ingredients in the user's pantry. If this is called from the pantryIngredientsMenu, then the pantrySearchMenu will slide into view. If this is called from clearFilter(), then no animation will play. This function handles all visual changes necessary to making this search.
      Parameters:
      slideIn - true if the pantrySearchMenu should slide into view or
      false if no animation should play.

    • returnToPantry

      public void returnToPantry()
      Switches from the pantrySearchMenu to the pantryIngredientsMenu when the backButton is clicked. This hides the filterMenu and resets any filters.

    • toggleIngredient

      public void toggleIngredient(boolean add, String ingredient)
      Adds or removes an ingredient from the user's pantry based on its CheckBox in the recipeMenu. If this event occurs in the pantrySearchMenu, then the search will be redone.
      Parameters:
      add - true if the given ingredient should be added or
      false if it should be removed.
      ingredient - Ingredient String to add/remove from the user's pantry.

    • escapeMenu

      public void escapeMenu(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent key)
      If the escape key is pressed while the recipeMenu is open, then the menu will be closed.
      Parameters:
      key - KeyEvent; if its KeyCode is ENTER, then the recipeMenu will be closed.

    • quickShake

      private void quickShake(javafx.scene.Node toShake)
      Quickly shakes a Node back and forth 4 times.
      Parameters:
      toShake - Node to quickly shake.

    • slideDown

      private void slideDown(javafx.scene.Node toSlide, boolean bounce)
      Slides a Node down from off-screen into view. Will conditionally play a "bounce" animation at the end of the slide depending on the arguments given.
      Parameters:
      toSlide - Node to slide down.
      bounce - true if the Node should bounce at the end of the slide or
      false if the Node should not bounce.
      See Also:
      • bounce(Node, boolean)

    • slideUp

      private void slideUp(javafx.scene.Node toSlide)
      Slides a Node up from off-screen into view.
      If this function is called from the Search menu, then the given Node will "bounce" at the end of the slide and the searchToolbar and searchInfo will also be given animations to play.
      If this function is called from the Favorites menu, then the menuTitle will slide down once this animation completes.
      Parameters:
      toSlide - Node to slide up.
      See Also:
      • bounce(Node, boolean)

    • bounce

      private void bounce(javafx.scene.Node toBounce, boolean up)
      Bounces a node in the direction indicated by the arguments.
      Parameters:
      toBounce - Node to bounce.
      up - true if the Node should bounce upwards or
      false if the Node should bounce downwards.

    • slideLeft

      private void slideLeft(javafx.scene.Node toSlide)
      Slides a Node left from off-screen into view.
      At the end of the sliding animation, the Node will bounce twice.
      Parameters:
      toSlide - Node to slide left.
      See Also:
      • slideBounce(Node)
      • secondBounce(Node)

    • slideBounce

      private void slideBounce(javafx.scene.Node toBounce)
      Bounces a slide to the right.
      At the end of the animation, a second bounce will play.
      Parameters:
      toBounce - Node to bounce right.
      See Also:
      • secondBounce(Node)

    • secondBounce

      private void secondBounce(javafx.scene.Node toBounce)
      Second bounce that plays after the animation in slideBounce(Node) finishes. This is much smaller than the first bounce to emulate "gravity".
      If this function is called by the Pantry menu, then the pantryIngredientsMenu will be shown.
      Parameters:
      toBounce - Node to bounce a second time.
      See Also:
      • slideBounce(Node)

    • slideRight

      private void slideRight(javafx.scene.Node toSlide)
      Slides a Node off-screen to the right.
      Parameters:
      toSlide - Node to slide right.

    • titleCase

      private String titleCase(String str)
      Converts the given String to title case. This function will ignore quotation marks at the beginning of the String and capitalize the first letter it finds.
      Parameters:
      str - String to be converted to title case.
      Returns:
      the given String in title case.

    • wrapText

      private String wrapText(String str, int rowLen)
      Creates a string with line breaks in it to create the illusion of wrapped text.
      Parameters:
      str - String to convert into wrapped text.
      rowLen - Maximum length of each "row" in the new String.
      Returns:
      a wrapped-text version of the given String.
